awd_abstract_narration: This is a Research Planning Grant (RPG) of the Research                         Opportunities for Women Initiative (ROW) that is being made by                  the Organic and Macromolecular Chemistry Program of the                         Chemistry Division.  It will provide Dr. Linda A. Jacob of the                  University of Scranton with resources and time to develop a                     research program.                                                                                                                                               The electrophilic substitution of aryltrimethylsilanes will be                  studied as a method for preparing phosphorous or fluorine                       containing aromatic amino acids.  The initial focus will be on                  simpler structures such as F-18 labelled peptides that might                    find use in radio imaging or where appropriate with magnetic                    imaging techniques.  The latter aspects will be carried out                     cooperatively with scientists at New York University Medical                    School.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
